intro: Lepismium mataralense, commonly known as the Mataral nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, humid environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
